item.title: Quidditch Champions: Tips For Playing Keeper
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Utilize the Playcaller ability to maximize efficiency and scoring potential in Quidditch Champions.
  • Practice in Training Mode to sharpen Keeper skills and perfect Playcaller routes in Quidditch Champions.
  • Master positioning, broom attributes, and interceptions to enhance defense as Keeper in Quidditch Champions.

Quidditch Champions lets players choose from the four different positions in Quidditch matches and experience how each one impacts the game. One of these positions is the Keeper, who, much like soccer or hockey goalkeepers, is the last line of defense for the team and needs to protect the rings from the opposing team’s attacks. Although defending three rings from the other team's Chasers can be challenging, with some tips and practice, players can become incredible Keepers in Quidditch Champions .

9 Find The Best Routes For Playcallers

Gain An Advantage For The Team In Quidditch Champions

Keepers in Quidditch Champions have a unique mechanic that provides significant advantages to Chasers during attacks. Known as Playcaller, this ability creates rings that increase the speed of teammates, making it essential for optimizing plays. Proper use of this ability maximizes team efficiency, boosting the chances of scoring points.

The goal is to position these rings to offer the best possible route for the allied Chaser, making it crucial for Keepers to make smooth route adjustments, avoiding abrupt direction changes. This prevents the Chaser from having to correct their trajectory mid-air, which could lead to a loss of speed due to a poorly placed ring.

8 Use Training Mode

Practice Makes Perfect

If, after several matches, players feel their Keeper skills still aren’t sharp enough, a good idea is to return to training mode and practice the game’s fundamentals. While simple, the Practice Mode in Quidditch Champions is highly customizable, allowing players to explore various mechanics of the characters.

For example, if a player wants to perfect Playcaller routes, they can do so in training without the pressure of knowing a mistake could harm the team. Additionally, it's possible to increase the difficulty of the opposing team, making the Chasers’ Quaffle shots more precise, which is ideal for training reaction time.

7 Switch To Chaser After Defending

Contribute To The Attack

In Quidditch Champions , players cannot maintain a fixed position, requiring them to alternate between roles with teammates for the best results. After defending the rings against the opposing attack, Keepers can quickly switch positions with Chasers.

This switch provides the team with more offensive options, as otherwise, the Chasers would be controlled by bots, which generally don't make the best decisions in terms of movement and passing. Having an extra player in the Chaser role is highly beneficial for creating better plays, but Keepers must be mindful of the perfect moment to make the switch, as the team can lose the Quaffle quickly and end up unprotected.

6 Get Comfortable With The Controls

Simple, Yet Potentially Confusing

Whether on keyboard or controller, Quidditch Champions features various commands, each with its specific function for the characters. Thus, whether as a Keeper or in another role, it’s important to be comfortable with the controls before entering a match, especially in PvP modes.

Given the high level of competitiveness in these modes, players might accidentally press the wrong button when defending a particular ring, heading in the wrong direction and allowing the opposing Chaser to score points. Therefore, familiarizing oneself with the controls before playing against other players is essential for a more satisfying experience.

5 Seek Optimal Positioning Between The Rings

Reduce The Opponent’s Chances Of Scoring

Whether in real sports or Quidditch Champions , one of the key fundamentals that Keepers must master is positioning to reduce the space for opposing Chasers and their chances of scoring with the Quaffle. While this skill comes with experience over time, some practices can be implemented from the start.

Staying positioned between the Quaffle and the central ring is an essential strategy for any Keeper looking to increase their chances of making a save. Aligning this way limits the opposing Chaser’s vision and options, forcing them to make risky passes or take long-distance shots, even allowing the Keeper to make a quick interception and initiate a counter-attack.

4 Choose The Right Broom Attributes

Identify Important Attributes To Prioritize

Brooms are not just cosmetic, and one of the best tips in Quidditch Champions is to examine the attributes each one offers and equip them based on the needs of the role. For example, Keepers can benefit from brooms that provide bonuses in durability and agility.

The Comet is a good choice for Keepers, as its agility allows them to move between rings faster, reducing the time it takes to cover the distance, which can make all the difference in a successful defense. Durability is also crucial since the opposing team’s Beater can take advantage of any weaknesses to knock the Keeper off their broom.

3 Go For Chaser Interceptions

Anticipate The Attack And Gain Possession

A good Keeper in Quidditch Champions doesn’t just wait for opposing Chasers to attack. In some situations, leaving the defensive position to intercept the Quaffle from an attacking Chaser can be an effective strategy for winning. When noticing a Chaser getting too close, try flying towards them and causing a quick interception.

However, this tactic can be risky. Keepers need to pay close attention to the opposing Chaser’s movements, as leaving the defensive position can leave the rings unprotected. Interceptions should only be attempted when there is confidence in success to avoid giving the opponent an easy shot.

2 Be Unpredictable To Fool Chasers

Avoid Being Read Easily By Opponents

One of the keys to becoming a good Keeper in Quidditch Champions is avoiding predictability. Experienced Chasers often trick Keepers by pretending to shoot toward one ring and then quickly changing direction. Maintaining varied movement and not focusing on just one or two rings reduces the chances of being outplayed by these strategies.

Additionally, observing the Chaser's behavior and identifying attack patterns can be a significant advantage. Noticing repetitive plays from opponents allows the Keeper to anticipate moves and even move forward to stop the play before the Quaffle is thrown toward the rings.

1 Skills To Take As A Keeper In Quidditch Champions

Teamwork Is A Great Skill For Support

Although Quidditch Champions has a skill system, it isn’t overly complex, making it easier for players unfamiliar with the genre to feel comfortable making choices. Regardless of which of the three skill trees Keepers choose, all offer interesting bonuses that can prove useful.

However, Teamwork is one of the skills to watch out for early in the game, as its main function is to improve Playcallers, the Keeper’s unique ability, by reducing its cooldown. Additionally, skills in this tree can even buff the allied Chasers’ speed when the Quaffle is shot to them rather than passed.

item.title: Roblox: Gym League Codes (September 2024)
item.description:
Gym League is an exciting Clicker Simulator on the Roblox platform with a gym theme. In this game, you must choose different strength training equipment for each muscle group and click a lot to get the best result and the most beautiful and athletic body. You can even take boosters that will accelerate the growth of your muscles and statistics, but you need in-game currency to purchase them.

Of course, you can participate in competitions to earn money, but you can also use Gym League codes to get some cash for free. You can get in-game currency or a ton of free boosters using free codes. But the codes have a limited expiration date, so hurry up and get all the rewards as quickly as possible.

Updated September 5, 2024, by Artur Novichenko: One new code arrived in this update, which means it's time to go to the gym and gain some muscle. Check back later for more freebies.

All Gym League Codes

Working Gym League Codes

  • PrisonBound - Enter this code to get 2 Toning Fruit. (NEW)
  • SummerVibes - Enter this code to get Power Ups.
  • HIDDENFOOD - Enter this code to get 2 Chakra Rations.
  • PirateBugFix - Enter this code to get 2 Cash Fruit.
  • DivineMuscles - Enter this code to get 1 Divine Fruit.
  • FruitPirate - Enter this code to get 2 Toning Fruit.
  • UPDATE2 - Enter this code to get Angel Potion.
  • 650KLikes - Enter this code to get 5 Aura Rerolls and 5 Pose Rerolls.
  • 150MVisits - Enter this code to get 3 Pose Rerolls, 3 Aura Rerolls, and other supplements.
  • 1MMembers - Enter this code to get 3 Premium Aura Rerolls.
  • 2.5MFavs - Enter this code to get 3 Creatine Powders, and 3 Premium Body Oil.
  • FOLLOWGYMLEAGUERBLX - Enter this code to get 3 Small Speed Potions.

Expired Gym League Codes

  • BattlePotion - Enter this code to get Mega Potions.
  • DEFLATION - Enter this code to get 1 Mega Potion.
  • 150KLikes - Enter this code to get 5 Aura Rerolls and 5 Pose Rerolls.
  • 100KActive - Enter this code to get Protein Shake.
  • 20MVisits - Enter this code to get power ups.
  • 1MVisits - Enter this code to get power ups.
  • 10KLikes - Enter this code to get 5 aura and Pose Reroll.
  • 5KLikes - Enter this code to get 1,000 Cash.
  • Release - Enter this code to get 100 Cash.
  • SORRY - Enter this code to get 3 Mega Potions.

Even though you can achieve great results by systematically visiting gyms for different muscle groups, the fact that players love freebies remains the same. Free boosters will not give you a cheating advantage but will only allow you to get some in-game currency to buy boosters or immediately reward you with a couple of chocolate bars or other energy products. To stir up players' interest, the developers will give players pleasant rewards, but remember that the Roblox codes have a limited expiration date, so use them as fast as possible to get all the freebies.

How to Redeem Gym League Codes

Like in most other games on the Roblox platform, the opportunity to redeem codes in Gym League is available immediately after the story introductory video. So, once you've gotten motivated enough to exercise and hit the gym, here's how you can get all the free rewards:

  • Launch Gym League in Roblox .
  • Click on the Codes icon on the left side of the screen.
  • Enter the code in the Code text box.
  • Click Submit, and you will receive your rewards.

How to Get More Gym League Codes

Similar to other Roblox games, new Gym League codes appear after global updates or after the game reaches new popularity levels. You can find all the new codes in the game description on the Roblox platform or by checking our guide periodically. But you can also subscribe to the official pages of the developers to stay up to date with new products and be the first to know about exclusive rewards:

  • Twitter
  • Discord
  • Roblox

item.title: How to Unlock All Lost Galaxy Stages in Astro Bot (All Secret Exits)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Find the Secret Exit in Az-Tech Trail
  • How to Find the Secret Exit in Creamy Canyon
  • How to Find the Secret Exit in Go-Go Archipelago!
  • How to Find the Secret Exit in Downsize Surprise
  • How to Find the Secret Exit in Bathhouse Battle
  • How to Find the Secret Exit in Free Big Brother!
  • How to Find the Secret Exit in Heiroglitch Pyramid
  • How to Find the Secret Exit in Balloon Breeze
  • How to Find the Secret Exit in Djinny of the Lamp
  • How to Find the Secret Exit in Frozen Meal

There are 75 stages in Astro Bot , ten of which can only be accessed by finding secret exits in some of the game's regular areas. Each of the five main star systems that players visit as part of the main story has two warps, which, when triggered, will take Astro to an area called the Lost Galaxy.

Players will be able to tell which stages have secret exits thanks to the warp icon on the stage select screen. They're usually pretty difficult to find due to their obscure locations, so those having trouble tracking them all down may want to consider using this guide to every Lost Galaxy warp in Astro Bot .

How to Find the Secret Exit in Az-Tech Trail

Not long after acquiring the boxing gloves power-up, players will find themselves in a room with a Russian doll enemy. After taking it out, they should destroy the four torches on the nearby wall, using the ladybug enemy as a springboard to reach the ones at the top. Once the torches are all gone, the wall will open up, granting access to the Az-Tech Trail warp planet.

How to Find the Secret Exit in Creamy Canyon

A few minutes into the stage, players will come to a pink pig enemy that they need to throw into a nearby wall of ice to proceed. However, if they turn around and throw the pig at the glass seal sculpture in the previous area, a blue X will appear on the ground where the seal once stood. Using Astro's spinning punch while standing on this spot will take players to a new area, which is where they'll find the Creamy Canyon warp planet.

How to Find the Secret Exit in Go-Go Archipelago!

After players beat Captain Pincher at the end of the stage, his claw will fly off and stick into the ground near a nearby tree stump, which will cause a blue X to appear on the ground. If players use Astro's spinning punch here, they'll be able to burrow down into a secret area containing the Go-Go Archipelago! warp planet.

How to Find the Secret Exit in Downsize Surprise

The Downsize Surprise stage has a bubble-blowing frog that players can activate by blowing into the microphone on their DualSense controller. After doing so, they should activate the mouse power-up to shrink down and then hop onto one of the bubbles. If they keep going past the cage with the trapped Bot inside, they'll be able to get onto the tree branch above and use it to reach the Downsize Surprise warp planet. There's no cable to pull this time though, so they'll need to push the red button to activate it instead.

How to Find the Secret Exit in Bathhouse Battle

Around halfway through the stage, players will find themselves in a garden area where they need to use the sponge power-up to soak a pile of sponges in a Mount Fuji mural. Rather than heading straight here, they should instead take a left through the red tori gate and onto the cherry blossom tree. From here, they can use the sponge power-up again to extinguish the flames coming out of the chimney and then hop inside. After using Astro's spinning punch to take out the screw enemy, they'll be free to interact with the Bathhouse Battle warp planet.

How to Find the Secret Exit in Free Big Brother!

Immediately after entering the stage, players should take a right and head out into the water towards the large stone structure. They'll need to trick the electric enemy here into shocking the two electricity pads, which they can do by standing on them and then moving out of the way after the enemy begins charging its attack. Once both pads have been zapped, the nearby rockface will open up and players will find the Free Big Brother! warp planet.

How to Find the Secret Exit in Heiroglitch Pyramid

After sliding down the slope at the end of the stage and arriving in the room with the regular exit, players should jump on the bounce pad on the right side of the room and then push out the block in the center of the golden wall. This will trigger a section where they need to clear two more golden walls to avoid being crushed, after which, they'll find themselves at the Heiroglitch Pyramid warp planet.

How to Find the Secret Exit in Balloon Breeze

Immediately after getting the pufferfish power-up from the giant, players should turn around and then use the ladybug enemy to launch Astro toward the platform off in the distance. Just as his booster is about to run out, they should activate the pufferfish power-up and then land on the aforementioned platform. Spinning the blue flower here will cause a new platform to appear, on which, players will find a cutting device. After using this to cut down the bamboo, they'll need to use Astro's booster to go around the edge of the newly revealed circular device, which will make the Balloon Breeze warp planet appear.

How to Find the Secret Exit in Djinny of the Lamp

After defeating the Djinny, players will find themselves in an area with the stage's regular exit. Rather than using it, though, they should look for a ledge on the wall to their right and use it to get as much height as possible. From there, they can activate the dog charge power-up to reach the top of the ledge at the back of the area. Here, they'll just need to punch the magic carpet to get it to unroll and then ride it up to the Djinny of the Lamp warp planet.

How to Find the Secret Exit in Frozen Meal

Near the very end of the stage, players will come to a snowy area with a ramp and four electric enemies. After defeating the latter with Astro's jets, they should turn their attention to the snowball that the two penguins are playing around with. If they roll this around enough, it will grow big enough for them to use as a platform to reach a ledge over to the left of the area. Here, they'll find a snow-blowing device that they can use to clear away the nearby snow wall to gain access to the Frozen Meal warp planet.

item.title: How to Find Every Crash Site Puzzle Piece in Astro Bot
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Crash Site Puzzle Piece 1
  • Crash Site Puzzle Piece 2
  • Crash Site Puzzle Piece 3
  • Crash Site Puzzle Piece 4
  • Crash Site Puzzle Piece 5
  • Crash Site Puzzle Piece 6
  • Crash Site Puzzle Piece 7
  • Crash Site Puzzle Piece 8
  • Crash Site Puzzle Piece 9
  • Crash Site Puzzle Piece 10
  • Crash Site Puzzle Piece 11

There are eleven Puzzle Pieces for players to track down in the Crash Site area of Astro Bot . Quite a few of them are out in the open and so are quite easy to find, but others will only show up if players interact with the environment around them in some way, shape, or form.

Finding every Crash Site Puzzle Piece will be important for those hoping to fully complete Astro Bot , as they'll need all 120 pieces to finish the Golden Statue puzzle. Thankfully, the following guide has instructions on how and when players can find each piece.

Crash Site Puzzle Piece 1

There's a small rock near the Mothership that can be lifted up using two Bots. Beneath it, players will find the first Crash Site Puzzle Piece.

Crash Site Puzzle Piece 2

Once they've rescued ten Bots, players will be able to lift a rock near the Dual Speeder to find the area's second Puzzle Piece.

Crash Site Puzzle Piece 3

Using ten Bots, players can for Bot Towers to lift the five stone slabs near the rock pillar, on top of which they'll find another Crash Site Puzzle Piece.

Crash Site Puzzle Piece 4

There's a Puzzle Piece over on a ledge on the far side of the Crash Site, which players can reach with the help of ten rescued Bots.

Crash Site Puzzle Piece 5

Using another ten Bots and a bird, players will be able to form a floating Bot Tower, which they can then use to reach the platform on which the Crash Site's fifth Puzzle Piece can be found.

Crash Site Puzzle Piece 6

One of the Crash Site Puzzle Pieces is being carried around by three birds and can be reached by jumping from a number of platforms and ledges in the area.

Crash Site Puzzle Piece 7

In the main part of the Crash Site are some bowling pins with a hole nearby. If players approach this hole, a creature will pop out of it holding a ball, at which point, players can punch the ball at pins. If they score a strike, a Puzzle Piece will appear.

Crash Site Puzzle Piece 8

After recovering the Mothership's Memory, players will gain access to a new area that requires 25 Bots to enter. Using 100 Bots to pull the blue pipe in this area will uncover a floating platform, which they can then ride up to the eighth Puzzle Piece.

Crash Site Puzzle Piece 9

After recovering the Mothership's SSD, players will gain access to a new area that requires 60 Bots to enter. If players use 40 Bots to flip the giant turtle here, they'll find the ninth Puzzle Piece on its back.

Crash Site Puzzle Piece 10

After recovering the Mothership's GPU, players will gain access to a new area of the Crash Site that requires 90 Bots to enter. There, they should use 80 bots to flip the large block of ice and then jump on the blue bounce pad to reach the ledge above them, which is where they'll find the tenth Crash Site Puzzle Piece.

Crash Site Puzzle Piece 11

After recovering the Mothership's cooling fan, players will gain access to the final area of the Crash Site. Using 100 Bots on one of the upper levels here will allow them to break through the floor, beneath which they'll find the last of the Crash Site Puzzle Pieces.

item.title: How to Change Region in Deadlock
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Change Region in Deadlock
  • Why Change Your Region in Deadlock?

Deadlock is the newest title from Valve Software, combining elements of both third-person shooters and MOBAs to deliver a fast-paced yet strategical competitive experience. Taking obvious inspiration from their past titles, such as DotA 2 and Team Fortress 2, Deadlock has lots to offer players, whether they're a fan of the numerous games it draws inspiration from, or new to the MOBA genre looking for a title to jump into.

When starting a game of Deadlock , the game's matchmaking system takes a variety of information into consideration, including the players' preferred characters, skill level, and automatically detected region. While these settings are meant to deliver the best possible experience to players, in the current Early Development build, a player's region also determines at what hours the time-limited matchmaking service is available to create player-vesus-player matches. These settings are largely out of the user's control, but players have found a way to change their matchmaking region to play against human opponents at any hour of the day.

How to Change Region in Deadlock

Changing matchmaking regions can be easily done through the developer console, accessed by pressing F7, and using the command citadel_region_override # . By replacing the pound symbol with different numbers, players can change which matchmaking region the game uses when creating a new game. At the time of writing, the available regions are:

Region

Command

Auto-detect

citadel_region_override -1

North America

citadel_region_override 0

Europe

citadel_region_override 1

Asia

citadel_region_override 2

South America

citadel_region_override 3

Oceania

citadel_region_override 5

The currently selected region can be confirmed in the bottom right of the main menu, next to the matchmaking hours information. The selected region will revert to auto-detection after closing the game, requiring players to re-enter the console command if they want to queue into a different region again.

The auto-detect setting is used to select the region that will give players the best possible connection to the game's servers. By selecting a different region, they will be connected to servers in different continents, greatly increasing the latency experienced in matches.

Why Change Your Region in Deadlock?

The automatically detected region Deadlock decides for players is used to ensure matches created are played on the closest servers available, reducing ping and improving the game's responsiveness. However, at the time of writing, the current build of Deadlock is an early alpha, featuring regional curfews restricting the matchmaking server to certain hours of the day depending on the user's region. While switching matchmaking regions can result in a worse connection to the game's servers, it also allows players to bypass the curfew present in their native region. The matchmaking availabilities for each region at the time of writing are as follows:

Region

Monday–Thursday

Friday–Sunday Curfew

North America

UTC 20:00 – 10:00

UTC 12:00 – 06:00

Europe

UTC 12:00 – 01:00

UTC 08:00 – 01:00

Asia

UTC 06:00 – 19:00

UTC 02:00 – 19:00

South America

UTC 18:00 – 07:00

UTC 14:00 – 07:00

Oceania

UTC 03:00 – 17:00

UTC 23:00 – 17:00
